intro: Rhodognaphalopsis duckei, commonly known as the Ducke's frostweed, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant thrives in high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky or alpine conditions. It is known for its ability to withstand cold temperatures and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
